description: APPORTION REPRESENTATIVES AMONG THE PEOPLE OF THE SEVERAL STATES ACCORDING TO THE FIRST CENSUS BY ASSIGNING A SPECIFIED NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES TO EACH STATE.
TO AMEND H.R. 147, TO PROVIDE THAT AFTER MARCH, 1793, THE HOUSE SHALL BE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS CHOSEN BY THE PEOPLE IN THE RATIO OF ONE FOR EVERY 33,000.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE ON AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 147 THAT WOULD PROVIDE THAT THE HOUSE SHALL BE COMPOSED OF 106 MEMBERS.
TO ADOPT THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 147 WHICH ASSIGNS A SPECIFIED NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES TO EACH STATE.
TO AMEND H.R. 147 BY STRIKING THE FIRST SECTION AND INSERT- ING AN AMENDMENT THAT WOULD PROVIDE FOR 99 MEMBERS AND A RATIO OF 1 TO 33,000.  (VICE PRES. VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE)
TO PASS H.R. 147.
TO RECEDE FROM CERTAIN AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 147.  (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE NEGATIVE)
TO ADHERE TO ITS DISAGREEMENTS TO FIRST HOUSE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 147.  (VICE PRESIDENT VOTED IN AFFIRMATIVE.)
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION, THAT A SPECIAL OCCASION NOW EXISTS FOR APPOINTING A MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY TO THE COURT OF FRANCE.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 26, (APP 2/16/92, 1 STAT 229), AN ACT FOR THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF BANK AND OTHER COD FISHERIES, AND FOR REGULATION OF FISHERMEN EMPLOYED THEREIN.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF GOVERNOR MORRIS OF NEW YORK TO BE MINISTER PLENIPOTENTIARY FOR THE U.S. AT PARIS, FRANCE.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A MINISTER TO THE HAGUE.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF WILLIAM SHORT, OF VIRGINIA TO BE MINISTER RESIDENT FOR THE U.S. AT THE HAGUE.

TO AMEND H.R. 162 (APP 3/5/92, 1 STAT 241), TO MAKE FURTHER AND MORE EFFECTUAL PROVISION FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE FRONTIERS; SO AS TO STRIKE THE SECTION WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE RAISING OF THREE ADDITIONAL INFANTRY REGIMENTS TO BE DISCHARGED WHEN PEACE IS DECLARED WITH THE INDIAN TRIBE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (APP 5/8/92, 1 STAT 275) TO REGULATE THE PROCESSES IN THE COURTS AND TO PROVIDE COMPENSATION FOR THE OFFICERS OF SAID COURTS, AND FOR JURORS AND WITNESSES; SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT PLAINTIFFS CAN PAY THEIR DEBTS AND COSTS IN GOLD OR SILVER.
TO ADOPT THE SECOND SECTION OF H.R. 162 WHICH WOULD RAISE THREE ADDITIONAL INFANTRY REGIMENTS UNTIL PEACE IS DECLARED WITH THE INDIAN TRIBES.
TO AMEND H.R. 162, SO AS TO STRIKE THE PROVISION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO EMPLOY A NUMBER OF INDIANS.
TO AMEND H.R. 162, SO AS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF MEN IN EACH REGIMENT FROM 960 TO 912.
TO AMEND H.R. 162, SO AS TO STRIKE THE SECOND SECTION AND INSERT A PROVISION TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO ENGAGE A CERTAIN NUMBER OF EXPERT WOODSMEN TO SERVE IN INFANTRY, OR CAVALARY FOR 10 MONTHS.
TO PASS H.R. 162.

TO AMEND THE BILL (APP 4/4/92, 1 STAT 253), PROVIDING FOR AN APPORTIONMENT OF REPRESENTATIVES AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES, ACCORDING TO THE FIRST ENUMERATION, AND MAKING PROVISION FOR ANOTHER ENUMERATION, AND AN APPORTIONMENT THEREON, TO COMPOSE THE HOUSE AFTER MARCH, 1797, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT AFTER MARCH, 1797, THE HOUSE SHALL BE COMPOSED OF 100 MEMBERS, ELECTED BY A RATIO OF 1 TO 30,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 152 (APP 3/23/92, 1 STAT 243), AN ACT FOR THE RELIEF OF CERTAIN WIDOWS, ORPHANS, INVALIDS, AND OTHER PERSONS; SO AS TO STRIKE THE FIRST SECTION.

TO AMEND H.R. 179 (APP 4/14/92, 1 STAT 253), AN ACT APPORTIONING REPRESENTATIVES AMONG THE PEOPLE OF SEVERAL STATES ACCORDING TO THE FIRST ENUMERATION, AFTER MARCH 1797; SO AS TO CHANGE THE EFFECTIVE DATE FROM MARCH 1797 TO MARCH 1793.
TO AMEND H.R. 179, SO AS TO REMOVE THE CLAUSE SETTING THE NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES AT 120 MEMBERS.
TO AMEND H.R. 179, SO AS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF REPRESEN- TATIVES BY FIFTEEN.

TO AMEND H.R. 179, SO THAT THE FIRST CLAUSE OF THE FIRST SEC. READS AS FOLLOWS: "BE IT ENACTED BY CONGRESS, THAT, FROM AND AFTER MAR. 1793, THE HOUSE SHALL BE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS ELECTED WITHIN THE SEVERAL STATES, ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT..."
TO AMEND H.R. 179, SO AS TO STRIKE THE SECOND SECTION OF THE BILL, WHICH CONCERNS THE REPRESENTATION FOR S. CAROLINA.
TO AMEND H.R. 179, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES BE 120 MEMBERS.

TO AMEND H.R. 179, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT INSTEAD OF DESIGNA- TING A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM EACH STATE, TO ELECT ONE REPRESENTATIVE FOR EACH 30,000 INDIVIDUALS, AND THE RESIDUE MEMBERS GOING TO STATES HAVING THE HIGHEST FRACTIONS.

TO AMEND H.R. 179; TO PROVIDE THAT AFTER MARCH 1793, THE HOUSE BE COMPOSED OF 120 MEMBERS, ONE MEMBER FOR EVERY 30,000 PERSONS, COMPUTED ACCORDING TO THE CONSTITUTIONAL RULE AND APPORTIONED TO AND ELECTED WITHIN SEVERAL STATES ACCORDING TO RESPECTIVE NUMBERS.
TO PASS H.R. 179.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION TO REQUEST THE PRESIDENT TO INFORM THE KING OF FRANCE THAT THE SENATE HAS RECEIVED HIS LETTER.
TO INSIST ON THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 179 WHICH PROVIDES THAT AFTER MARCH 1793, THE HOUSE WILL BE COMPOSED OF 120 MEMBERS.
TO RECEDE FROM ALL THOSE SENATE AMENDMENTS, BUT THE FIRST, TO H.R. 179, DISAGREED TO BY THE HOUSE.
TO AGREE TO THE SENATE RESOLUTION THAT IT BE A STANDING RULE THAT THE DOORS OF THE SENATE REMAIN OPEN DURING LEGISLATIVE SESSIONS EXCEPT WHEN SECRECY IS DEEMED NECESSARY.
TO PASS H.R. 148 (5/2/92, 1 STAT 264), AN ACT MORE EFFECTUALLY TO PROVIDE FOR THE NATIONAL DEFENSE BY ESTABLISHING A UNIFORM MILITIA THROUGHOUT THE U.S.

TO AGREE TO THE 3RD SEC. OF H.R. 174, (APP 4/21/92, 1 STAT 257), AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE GRANT AND CONVEYANCE OF CERTAIN LANDS TO THE OHIO COMPANY OF ASSOCIATES; THAT THE PRESIDENT BE AUTHORIZED TO GRANT AND CONVEY TO THE OHIO COMPANY OF ASSOCIATES, 100,000 ACRES OF LAND, ON CERTAIN CONDITIONS.

TO AGREE TO THE TWELFTH SECTION OF S. 35, (APP 5/8/92, 1 STAT 279), AN ACT RESPECTING ALTERATIONS NECESSARY TO BE MADE IN THE ACTS ESTABLISHING THE TREASURY AND WAR DEPARTMENTS; TO GRANT ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION TO CERTAIN OFFICIALS.

TO AMEND H.R. 174, (APP 4/21/92, 1 STAT 257), AN ACT AUTHORIZING A GRANT OF LANDS TO THE OHIO COMPANY OF ASSOCIATES; TO EXTEND TO CERTAIN NAMED INDIVIDUALS THE SAME PRIVILEGES OFFERED TO THE OHIO COMPANY.
TO AGREE TO THE SENATE RESOLUTION THAT WOULD ADMIT HOUSE MEMBERS DURING SENATE DEBATE AND PERMIT SENATORS TO HAVE TWO GUESTS EACH.
TO AMEND H.R. 177 (APP 4/27/92, 1 STAT 258), AN ACT TO INDEMNIFY THE ESTATE OF THE LATE MAJOR GENERAL NATHANIEL GREENE; SO AS TO EXCEPT A CERTAIN CONDITIONAL BOND.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF EDWARD CHURCH AS U.S. CONSULTANT AT LISBON, PORTUGAL.

TO ADHERE TO DISAGREEMENT TO AN AMENDMENT TO S. 28, (APP 5/8/92, 1 STAT 275), AN ACT FOR REGULATING PROCESSES IN THE COURTS AND TO PROVIDE COMPENSATION FOR OFFICERS, JURORS AND WITNESSES; AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE OPTION TO PAY DEBT AND COSTS IN GOLD OR SILVER.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION THAT THE PRESIDENT CONCLUDE A TREATY WITH THE GOVERNMENT OF ALGIERS FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF PEACE, AT AN EXPENSE NOT EXCEEDING $40,000 TO BE PAID AT SIGNATURE, AND DURING CONTINUANCE OF SAME TO PAY A SUM OF $25,000 ANNUALLY AND THAT THE PRESIDENT ALSO CONCLUDE A TREATY WITH SAID GOVERNMENT FOR THE PAYMENT OF A SUM NOT EXCEEDING $40,000 ALL EXPENSES INCLUSIVE FOR THE RANSOM OF THIRTEEN AMERICANS HELD IN CAPTIVITY THERE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (APP 12/31/92, 1 STAT 287), CONCERNING THE REGISTERING AND RECORDING OF SHIPS; SO AS TO STRIKE THE PROVISION TO RESTRICT PART OF THE BILL TO SHIPS OWNED AND COMMANDED BY AN AMERICAN CITIZEN.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION TO PUBLISH SENATE PROCEEDINGS IN NEWSPAPERS.

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT IT BE A STANDING RULE THAT THE DOORS OF THE SENATE CHAMBER REMAIN OPEN WHILE SITTING EXECUTIVE CAPACITY EXCEPT ON OCCASION WHERE SECRECY MAY PREVAIL; TO TAKE EFFECT THE FIRST DAY OF THE NEXT SESSION.

TO AGREE TO THE FIRST SECTION OF THE BILL (2/12/95, 1 STAT 301), RELATIVE TO CLAIMS AGAINST THE U.S., NOT BARRED BY ANY ACT OF LIMITATIONS, WHICH HAVE NOT BEEN ADJUSTED; SAID SECTION PROVIDES FOR SETTLEMENT OF ALL ACCOUNTS WITH THE STATES, AND CONCERNS SIX MONTH LOANS.

TO AGREE TO THE THIRD SECTION OF THE HOUSE BILL (APP 2/28/93, 1 STAT 325), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR 1793; SAID SECTION AUTHORIZES THE PRESIDENT TO BORROW A CERTAIN AMOUNT ON THE ACCOUNT OF CERTAIN STATES.

TO RECEDE FROM THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 11 (APP 2/18/93, 1 STAT 324), TO REGULATE THE CLAIMS TO INVALID PENSIONS, SAID AMENDMENT WOULD PROVIDE A LIFE PENSION TO EACH DISABLED VETERAN PLUS SUCH ARREARS OF PENSION AS THOUGHT JUST BY THE CIRCUIT COURT.
TO AMEND THE BILL (APP 3/1/93, 1 STAT 329), TO REGULATE TRADE AND INTERCOURSE WITH THE INDIAN TRIBES; TO PERMIT A LICENSE TO BE ISSUED TO ANYONE FOR TRADE WITH INDIAN TRIBES.
